titleStmt.title: Herman Hadlan v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Herman Hadlan v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the Justice Court of Olympia Precinct Thurston County Washington Territory before W T Keady Esq Justice of the Peace siting as committing magistrate of the City of Olympia
The City of Olympia vs Herman Hadlan
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss
To the Marshall of the City of Olympia

Whereas, at a Committing magistrate court held at my office in said City of Olympia County of Thurston and Territory of Washington for the trial of Herman Hadlan for the offense hereinafter stated the said Herman Hadlan after a plea of N L Gwitty and of jury trial was convicted of having on the 2nd day of July AD 1884 in the City of Olympia County of Thurston Territory of Washington committed the offense of violating City Ordinance Number 149 together with City Ordinance Number 191 which is an amendment thereto in selling and drinking liquor without first obtaining a license so to do as required by said Ordinance, in this that said Herman Hadlan did on the 2nd day of June 1884 in the City of Olympia County and Territory aforesaid then and there give sell and dispense of malt liquor towit to one C.N. Maurril for a consideration he the said Herman Hadlan there and then not having a license as required by Ordinances Number 149 and 191 of the City of Olympia so to do.

And upon convictions the said Court did adjudge and determine that the said Herman Hadlaw should pay a fine in the sum of five Dollars and costs of prosecution total of nine and 90/100 Dollars and in default thereof stand committed to the CIty jail until said fine and costs were paid or he be discharged by due process of law.

Therefore, for the said Marshall are commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to carry and deliver the said Herman Hadlan to the keeper of said City jail. And you, the said keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said Herman Hadlan into your custody in said jail and herein there safely keep until said trial and costs are paid or until he shall cause be discharged by due course of law.
Dated this 2nd day of July 1884 W.T. Keady
Committing magistrate of the City of Olympia.
